H0.text: Synthesize sugars is the function of chloroplasts that absorb light energy.

H1.text: Synthesize proteins is the function of chloroplasts, which absorb light energy.

H2.text: Transform sugar into cellular energy is the function of the chloroplast that absorbs light energy.

H3.text: Transform proteins into useful nutrients is the function of the chloroplast, which absorbs light energy.

A4.text: The chemical energy created is then used to make sugar and other organic molecules from carbon dioxide in a process called the Calvin cycle.

A5.text: Chloroplasts have a high concentration of chlorophyll pigments which capture the energy from sunlight and convert it to chemical energy and release oxygen.
